title: The Tontatta's Gullibility as Exploitation Allegory
theoryText: The Tontatta's extreme gullibility and subsequent exploitation by Doflamingo serves as an allegory for colonial exploitation of indigenous peoples. Their trust in promises, superhuman labor abilities, and tragic enslavement mirror historical patterns of powerful entities taking advantage of trusting populations.
author: Various One Piece fans

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Spoils the reveal of Doflamingo's exploitation of the Tontatta tribe

title: Usopp's Connection to the Tontatta
theoryText: Some fans theorized that Usopp might have ancestral connections to the Tontatta tribe based on his exceptional marksmanship and the tribe's own skilled warriors. While not directly stated in this episode, the theory gained traction when Usopp later became the Tontatta's hero 'God Usopp.'
author: r/OnePiece community

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains spoilers about Usopp's relationship with the Tontatta tribe

title: Violet's True Allegiance Foreshadowed
theoryText: Viewers who paid close attention to Violet's tears in earlier episodes theorized she was secretly working against Doflamingo before her betrayal was confirmed. Episode 641's revelation of her genuine emotions vindicated these theories about her true loyalties.
author: Various One Piece analysts
